Advanced data
Item ID25781

The ash sanctifier is a reward from completing the Hard Kourend & Kebos Diary, where players can then claim it from Tyss near the Dark Altar. To use it, it must be charged with death runes, gaining 10 charges per death rune at a cost of 18.9 per charge. It can hold a maximum of 2,147,483,647 charges.

When charged and carried in the inventory, the ash sanctifier will automatically purify demonic ashes that are dropped from demonic creatures upon death, granting the player half the Prayer experience they would have received from scattering the ashes themselves, or the full amount if the Elite Kourend & Kebos Diary is completed, consuming one charge in the process. This effect can be toggled with the right-click "Activity" option.

Cost[edit | edit source]

Ashes Hard Kourend & Kebos Diary Elite Kourend & Kebos Diary
XP Cost/XP[1] GE Cost/XP[2] XP Cost/XP[1] GE Cost/XP[2]
Fiendish ashes 5 −3.78 −38.78 10 −1.89 −19.39
Vile ashes 12.5 −1.51 −47.99 25 −0.76 −24
Malicious ashes 32.5 −0.58 −48.64 65 −0.29 −24.32
Abyssal ashes 42.5 −0.44 −59.23 85 −0.22 −29.61
Infernal ashes 55 −0.34 −81.27 110 −0.17 −40.64
  1. ^ 1.0 1.1 Compared to leaving ashes.
  2. ^ 2.0 2.1 Compared to banking and selling ashes.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
12 August 2021
(update | poll)

The ash sanctifier now gives full Prayer experience upon completing the Elite Kourend & Kebos Diary.

30 June 2021
(update)

The amount of charges provided per death rune has been decreased from 100 to 10. Existing charges before this update have been divided by 10.

23 June 2021
(update)

The ash sanctifier will now prompt the player to input the desired amount of death runes to charge the item, rather than just taking all of it from the player's inventory.

17 June 2021
(update) 		Hotfix

The ash sanctifier no longer gives full Prayer experience upon completing the Elite Kourend & Kebos Diary, as the original poll never specified giving full experience for scattering ashes with the sanctifier.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • This item was initially named as the "Ash scatterer" in the original poll blog, but was changed to "Ash sanctifier" after player feedback.
